results.title: Baroque dance 1675-1725 (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The dance which evolved to perfection within the French Academy though called ‘Baroque’, shares attributes with French classicism. Presents the dance within the visual context of the period showing the consistency in concept with other arts of the time. No other credits available.

results.title: Bantu tribes of Southern Africa
results.creator_credit: Willem Vilioen and Paul Hoefler Special Productions
results.brief_description: Describes the old ways of life among the Zulu, Xhosa, Swazi, Ndebele, Sotho and Venda tribes. These various Bantu groups are now being brought into the South African industrial community. Outlines the ways in which this movement is changing the culture of the tribes and the struggle to preserve some of the old ways.

results.title: Ballet robotique
results.brief_description: This dynamic and playful work examines the use of robots in American industry. Exploiting the visual joys of the kinetic robotic motion set to a soundtrack by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra, this lightly humorous film show the industrial replacement of humans in tedious and hazardous tasks.

results.title: Ballet by Degas
results.creator_credit: J.H. Lenauer, George Jacobson and Mavis Lyons
results.brief_description: Studies of a number of the ballet paintings by Edgar Degas (1834-1917): “The Ballet Class”, “Coryphee Resting”, “Ballerina and the Lady with the Fan”, all from the Philadelphia Museum of Art, and “On Stage”, “Dancers Practising at the Bar”, and “Pink and Green” from the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

results.title: Bali: the island paradise
results.brief_description: An introduction to Bali emphasising village life, agriculture and culture with a focus on traditional dancing. Narrated by James A. FitzPatrick.

results.title: Thailand: a land of smiles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”
Presents traditional aspects of the culture of Thailand. Discusses the geography, emphasising the importance of water for travel and agriculture. Shows dances, festivals, handicrafts, and the influence of religion on Thailand’s culture.

results.title: Bakhtiari migration. [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Anthony Howarth, David Koff and Anthony-David Productions
results.brief_description: An excellent record of one of the most hazardous feats of human endurance still undertaken. Shows the way in which half a million people together with millions of valuable sheep, goats, mules, and dogs struggle for five weeks to make the two hundred mile crossing of the Zagros mountains in southern Iran.

results.title: Baked bean story
results.brief_description: This film shows the various steps involved in the production of the famous British “delicacy” of baked beans from their beginnings on an Ontario farm to the time when they are devoured as part of a typical English meal. A useful example of vertically integrated food processing and the importance of quality control in manufacturing. Suitable for Upper Primary-Lower Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: Badminton: gripping, footwork, serving
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles of correct badminton technique. Shows backhand and forehand grips; placement od feet when serving and playing; and the different types of serves - low short forehand, low short backhand, flick serve and drive serve.
